intro: Lindernia bifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Lindernia bifolia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
